data.title: Springfield in November
data.text: Room fair, shower hot, bar empty, draft beer expensive and overall somewhat overpriced for a Courtyard and it wasn't explained that the breakfast buffet not included. It wasn't much anyway and decided to leave and pay for a real breakfast.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear bluegrass502,
Thank you for your review of the hotel and our amenities. I apologize that it was not explained that the breakfast buffet was not included. Most Courtyards are designed with a Bistro, offering coffee and food items for sale. We have our own branded restaurant, Mela Urban Bistro, and operate under the same Courtyard standards in which we provide breakfast at a cost. Again, my apologies that this was not clear. 

We do hope that if your travels bring you back to Springfield we can be of service.

Kind regards,
Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: Good Location to Walk Springfield
data.text: This is a nice hotel right in the middle of sites in Springfield. Easy parking, friendly and helpful staff, clean comfortable rooms, average bedding. They had a nice looking restaurant with outdoor seating-did not eat there. Really good cafe/coffee/sandwiches across the street at Clark County Historical Society.  Walk a block through pleasant downtown to Seasons Bistro****.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
York476,
We appreciate you taking the time to comment about your stay with us. We're glad that you found our location and walkability to other businesses to be good - we think we're in a great spot here in Downtown Springfield. Un Mundo (across the street in the Heritage Center) and Seasons Bistro are both great options for venturing out of the hotel just a short distance. We're glad you were able to partake in some of Springfield's local dining. 
If you were not able to make it to visit the Heritage Center Museum and your travels bring you back to the area, it is definitely a must-see if history interests you and you want to learn more about Clark County. There are fascinating pieces of this area's history right across the street from the hotel.  

Thanks again for the kind words.

Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: I'm usually a big fan of Courtyards and try to stay in them when it works out.   But this time I think I made a mistake.  First, TRAIN TRACKS.  Yes, the hotel is directly adjacent to a busy train track.   Second, tired.   This downtown hotel is a little wore; one elevator broke, mattress poor, and carpet worn.   The A/C unit didn't work very good the first night (they did get it working better for the second night).  The bar and full service restaurant are a plus.  And the staff was friendly.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear DCA2113, 
I apologize for the inconveniences that you've experienced. Yes, we are located adjacent to a train track. We are fortunate that the City of Springfield worked diligently with Norfolk Southern to create a "quiet zone" within the city limits. While it doesn't eliminate all of the train noise, it does buffer it quite a bit since the trains are not allowed to blow their horns.  
I am pleased to pass along that the major repair on our elevator is near completion and the carpet in rooms will soon be cleaned professionally. I am sorry that you were here at time when you had to experience both of those deficiencies.

Thank you again for your patronage and we hope you'll choose the Courtyard by Marriott for your next stay in Springfield.

Becky Krieger
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good location and that's about it!
data.text: Enjoyed the downtown location with good restaurants and a microbrewery nearby.  As others have mentioned, there is only one working elevator.  The stairways lead only to the outside.  So, going to the bar area for morning coffee via the stairway meant going back into the hotel.  Not a problem, just inconvenient.  Our room was worn, with a few stains on the carpet and bathroom floor and a very stiff shower curtain liner.  The rooms are not soundproof, we heard noise from hallway and neighboring room & bathroom. Disappointing for a Courtyard, I expect better quality.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Fortunately, we are nearing the end and it should be up and operational in the near future. Kind regards,
Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: Elevator is still broken
data.text:
We stayed here in May for the Springfield antique extravaganza and found the elevator to be broken.  Since only 1 was working, there was always a line.  The front desk lady was extremely rude and hateful to be honest.....I didn't want to stay here this time.  Since we are platinum elite members, we always stay at a Marriot.   

This time (we were here for the fall extravaganza) there was a different front desk guy....he was very friendly and was super apologic about the elevator still being broken.....it took longer than expected to get it fixed.

The beds are comfortable but the rooms never got really cold even when we cranked it down.  The location around the hotel is lovely and the pool is nice.

Hoping to see the elevator fixed soon.  Glad the mean front desk girl wasn't there.

owner_response.text:

Thank you for your loyalty to Marriott and for taking the time to comment. Just as our front desk did, I apologize greatly for the inconvenience that the elevator outage caused you. It was May when one of the elevators was put out of service and we are very close to the end of the process. Unfortunately, it has been quite an extensive repair that has taken time to research and build. There is an end in sight - we are hoping it will be complete within the next couple of weeks. 

We do appreciate you returning, even though you didn't wish to, and we hope to see you again on a future visit to Springfield.

Kind regards,
Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: One of the few in Springfield
data.text: Had a good stay here. Stayed in a suite.  The suite itself was pretty average, but the bed was super comfy, so had a good night's rest.  The elevator was out (we knew this from reading other reviews), but it wasn't really an issue for us. The hotel was fully booked (there was a bus full of athletes and a few weddings), so it was a bit loud and busy...but it wasn't really an issue.  Breakfast was just ok (it was comp'ed by the staff), but the Dinner was surprisingly great.  The staff was great and took care of us.  There aren't too many great hotel options in Springfield so I think the Courtyard is your best bet.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Van P,
Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay with us here at the Courtyard by Marriott - Springfield Downtown. We are happy to hear that you had a good stay and a good night's rest. Thank you for the kind words and understanding on the elevator outage. The repair is close to completion - we are looking forward to that day! We do consider ourselves on a different level from the other hotels in our area due to our conference space as well as our amazing restaurant, Mela Urban Bistro. We're glad that you enjoyed dinner and we will use the breakfast comments to better what we're doing.

Thanks again,
Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: Rude Night Manager
data.text: The Room itself was ok, but the bathroom was another matter all together. The Toilet was slow and would not fully flush (you know how terrible THAT is!) And the Shower curtain liner was Filthy! When I talked about it to management, they assured me it would be changed. When I returned some hours later it was not. I returned to the front desk and asked when it would be changed and the Manager told me that a new one was already in place. I asked her what room did they change it in, because maybe I had said the wrong number by mistake. I did not. She assured me it was my room and it had been changed. I said no it had not. She suggested I was mistaken, because she had personally seen to it. I said again no I t was not changed. I asked her to come and look at it, and she said AGAIN it was changed. Normally this Is when I walk away, but that thing was filthy & I had to shower with it, so I persisted. She finally relented and came up, after basically calling me a liar in front of the Hotel Staff & guests, She comes up with someone from housekeeping and I show them the liner. The housekeeper apologized & said "I am sorry, I missed that spot when they sent me up to clean it." I said the manager (who was still there) said it was replaced. She said No I was told to come clean it. The manger rolled her eyes at me & left without a word. She would not even acknowledge me for the rest of my stay, and would walk away when I approached the desk. Something that could have turned an unpleasant experience into a positive one was ruined by an unprofessional person. I am glad for automated check out and the app, so I did not have to interact with this person again. I will pick another hotel for any further visits to my family.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear W S,
Thank you for taking the time to comment regarding your stay with us. I am deeply apologetic for the service and the product that you received. That is in no way Marriott's standard, nor is it ours. I have done a bit of research and I believe that the person that you are referring to is one of our supervisors. Regardless of who it was, the service provided was unacceptable. I would like to make sure that I address the proper person - if you would please contact me directly so I may get a better description, I would greatly appreciate it.

Kind regards,
Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: A surprise in Springfield
data.text:
Springfield, Ohio is like many modest sized towns in the mid-west - sort of run-down and dying.  But smack-dab in the middle of downtown is this lovely hotel. Yes, one of the two elevators was down while we were there.  It did make for some long waits, but the staff did as much as they could to accommodate everyone.  The room was spacious and came with a mini-fridge.  No freezer compartment, but the staff was great about putting my frozen "chillers" in the restaurant freezer at night.  One downside for dog people is that there are no rooms on the first floor.  Right outside the door is a nice walking path.
The restaurant is not open on Sunday nights, but you can get food from the bar, and the bartender will serve you in the lounge area.  It was delicious, and we were able to sit there with our dogs - a rare treat!

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear SnitchsMom,
Thanks for taking the time to comment and share your kind words. We are trying our hardest to make the best of the elevator outage that we've been experiencing, and the wait will soon be over. The entire cylinder should be delivered and installed in the near future, taking us back to 2 fully operational elevators. 
We're glad that you were happy with your stay and that we were able to accommodate your four-legged family members! 

We hope you'll return soon,
Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: Beautiful Hotel, great staff
data.text:
We usually stay at the Fairfield when we visit my hometown, but they we're booked so we tried this one based on the reviews. 

Nice hotel, great staff, very attentive and welcoming, rooms are clean and roomy for the price. We had a corner king with the balcony, and it was a beautiful day to sit and view the clock tower. 

My only complaint was the train! It woke me up several times in the night, thank goodness for the ear plugs the staff puts on the night stand. I know there is nothing that can be done about the train, but may pick another room more interior next time. 

Great stay.

data.title: Basic hotel
data.text: I wish Courtyards would recognize Marriott status in some way.  Handing you a bottle of water at check in or giving out breakfast coupons would make me want to stay at them more often.  If you need a handicapped accessible room be aware they only come with a queen bed, no doubles or kings.  I wish I had been advised of this when making my reservation.   We asked for a room away from the tracks so noise from the train was never an issue.  We had dinner at the restaurant one night and despite being the only customers it took over an hour for the food to be brought to the table.  The beds and pillows are very comfortable and our room was clean.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear loudoncruiser,
Thank you - #1 - for being a loyal Marriott Rewards member. Your business is no doubt appreciated. I am not sure if you are aware, but we are offering a new promotion that provides discounted room rates for Marriott Rewards members. If you'd like more information, I'd be glad to help.
Thank you - #2 - for taking the time to comment on your stay here at the Courtyard - Springfield Downtown. TripAdvisor is a great platform to share things about our hotel with others. You are correct - our handicapped accessible rooms do have 1 queen bed.  For those needing it, we do have the adjoining room available to offer more space. For instances when this is needed, one would need to speak directly to myself or our Guest Care Manager so we can ensure that this is available. We can be reached at 937.322.3600. 
I do apologize that your dinner took over an hour. We are a local restaurant that makes everything fresh. Dinner, at times, can take 1-2 hours from start to finish. We try to share that with our new guests, and I'm sorry that wasn't passed along. 

Thanks again for your comments and we hope to see you soon,
Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: If there are ear plugs in your room, change rooms!
data.text:
Stayed one night at this hotel, was in town for a horse show. Hotel is very nice, we paid a decent amount just to sleep a few hours, bed were amazingly comfortable. HOWEVER, we noticed ear plugs when we got into our room, didn't think much of it, although a bit odd, within 5 minutes of putting our head to the pillow to go to sleep we heard the loudest train go by that was the sound of metal on metal, screeching for what seemed like 10 minutes! This happened multiple times until the morning. 
We had friends staying at the hotel as well, they were on the other side, said they didn't have ear plugs in their room and didn't hear the train. If you find ear plugs upon entering your room, go down and ask for a new room. Hotel is way to expensive to be next to the loudest train I have ever heard!!!!!

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear KendallsMom,
Thank you for your comments. While I am glad that you found our beds to be comfortable, I do apologize that you were not able to get a good night's rest due to the trains. We are, indeed, close to a railroad track. There are evenings when we don't have any trains and others where there are a handful. We are fortunate to be located in a "quiet zone" where the trains do not blow their horns unless there is an obstruction on the tracks. Unfortunately, with a train still comes the sound of it traveling on the track and sometimes that can be loud. We do take a proactive approach in all of our guestrooms to make sure that guests have a restful stay, which includes earplugs. Your friends not having them in their room was probably an oversight on our part. We do make every accommodation for guests requesting to be on the north end of the building, away from the tracks. 
If your travels do bring you back to Springfield, please call the hotel directly to request a north end room. We'll do our best to make that happen.

Kind regards,
Becky Krieger
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Service
data.text:
Location is great, for some people the train passing by may be disturbing but I loved it. It gave the experience a special touch. It stops running after hours and I did not hear it early in AM. 

Good parking area with plenty of space. 

The front desk service was great, I had an issue with my room when I first went up stairs and the attention given to my issue with the prompt solution was great. Naomi in the front desk was truly willing to help and made me feel important. Things will happen, thats life, its the way that solutions are found and how eager people are to deliver a good experience that makes all the difference. 

Loved the fact that there is an attached nice restaurant. Great menu and great environment. 

Clean room with great shower, my pet peeve. The bed was very comfortable, loved the pillows.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Courtyard Springfield Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Jaime U,
Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay with us. You are correct, things will happen, that's life. While we don't intend for or like it when our guests have a negative experience, to err is human and, after all, that is what we are. It is indeed these experiences that test us, teach us, and make us better at what we do. I'm glad that we were able to get the issue resolved promptly for you.

I will be sure to pass along the kind words to Naomi - I know that will make her day. 

Thanks again - we hope you visit us again soon!
Becky Krieger
General Manager
